'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-11 10:30:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/9528ebca089363ff86ef551c59de8ecbb2c83149', 'message': 'Restart rabbit if can't list queues or found memory alert

W/o this fix the dead end situation is possible
when the rabbit node have no free memory resources left
and the cluster blocks all publishing, by design.
But the app thinks "let's wait for the publish block have
lifted" and cannot recover.

The workaround is to monitor (at CHECK_LEVEL 30) results
of crucial rabbitmqctl commands and restart the rabbit node,
if queues/channels/alarms cannot be listed or if there are
memory alarms found.
This check level 30 is being executed only on nodes
with a slave role and assumes the rabbit app running healthy.
This is the similar logic as we have for the cases when
rabbitmqctl list_channels hangs. But the channels check is also
changed to verify if the exit code>0 under the check level 30
as we want the rabbitmqctl to be always availabe at this level.

The monitor action will also explicitly stop the failed resource,
if  generic errors detected on any check level. This shortens the
'monitor->stop->start' chain for detected failures drastically.
Additional checks added to the monitor also require extending
the timeout window for the monitor action from 60 to 180 seconds.

Besides that, this patch makes the monitor action to gather the
rabbit status and runtime stats, like consumed memory by all
queues of total Mem+Swap, total messages in all queues and
average queue consumer utilization. This info should help to
troubleshoot failures better.

DocImpact: ops guide. If any rabbitmq node exceeded its memory
threshold the publish became blocked cluster-wide, by design.
For such cases, this rabbit node would be recovered from the
raised memory alert and immediately stopped to be restarted
later by the pacemaker. Otherwise, this blocked publishing state
might never have been lifted, if the pressure persists from the
OpenStack apps side.

Closes-bug: #1463433

Change-Id: I91dec2d30d77b166ff9fe88109f3acdd19ce9ff9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Restart rabbit if can't list queues or found memory alert

W/o this fix the dead end situation is possible
when the rabbit node have no free memory resources left
and the cluster blocks all publishing, by design.
But the app thinks "let's wait for the publish block have
lifted" and cannot recover.

The workaround is to monitor results
of crucial rabbitmqctl commands and restart the rabbit node,
if queues/channels/alarms cannot be listed or if there are
memory alarms found.
This is the similar logic as we have for the cases when
rabbitmqctl list_channels hangs. But the channels check is also
fixed to verify if the exit code>0 when the rabbit app is
running.

Additional checks added to the monitor also require extending
the timeout window for the monitor action from 60 to 180 seconds.

Besides that, this patch makes the monitor action to gather the
rabbit status and runtime stats, like consumed memory by all
queues of total Mem+Swap, total messages in all queues and
average queue consumer utilization. This info should help to
troubleshoot failures better.

DocImpact: ops guide. If any rabbitmq node exceeded its memory
threshold the publish became blocked cluster-wide, by design.
For such cases, this rabbit node would be recovered from the
raised memory alert and immediately stopped to be restarted
later by the pacemaker. Otherwise, this blocked publishing state
might never have been lifted, if the pressure persists from the
OpenStack apps side.

Closes-bug: #1463433

Change-Id: I91dec2d30d77b166ff9fe88109f3acdd19ce9ff9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/37/190137/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TOTALVMEM=`free -mt | awk '/Total:/ {print $2}'` # has timed out (which is a code 137 or 124) # NOTE: The check level > 20 assumes the rabbit app is running healthy if [ "$OCF_CHECK_LEVEL" -gt 20 ]; then # Check if the list of all queues is available, # also report some queues stats and total virtual memory. # If list_queueus has timed out (which is a code 137 or 124) or exited>0, # return generic error as it likely means a dead end situation # when rabbitmq cluster is running with blocked publishing due # to high memory watermark exceeded. local queues=`su_rabbit_cmd "${OCF_RESKEY_ctl} -q list_queues memory messages consumer_utilisation"` rc2=$? if [ $rc2 -eq 137 -o $rc2 -eq 124 ]; then ocf_log err "${LH} rabbitmqctl list_queues is not responding. The resource is failed." return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC elif [ $rc2 -ne 0 ]; then ocf_log err "${LH} Cannot get the list of queues. The resource is failed." return $OCF_ERR_GENERIC else local q_c=`echo -e "${queues}" | wc -l` local m_kb=`echo -e "${queues}" | awk -v sum=0 '{sum+=$1} END {print sum}'` local mem=$(( $m_kb / 1024 )) local mes=`echo -e "${queues}" | awk -v sum=0 '{sum+=$2} END {print sum}'` local c_u=`echo -e "${queues}" | awk -v sum=0 -v cnt=${q_c} '{sum+=$3} END {print (sum+1)/(cnt+1)}'` ocf_log info "${LH} RabbitMQ consumes ${mem}m of ${TOTALVMEM}m virtual memory available and running ${q_c} queues containing ${mes} messages total with an average consumer utilization of ${c_u}" fi fi
deleted_lines: # has timed out (which is a code 137)

commit_message:
Follow Neutron changes

* OVS and linuxbrige agents moving under ML2
* loopingcall moving to OSLO
* follow changes in linuxbridge agent main()

Change-Id: I0c31f7207bee9ad1483e4d8d2b76e5be22fab5e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/73/199473/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_service import service from neutron.common import utils as n_utilsfrom neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent \ import LinuxBridgeNeutronAgentRPC from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent \ import LinuxBridgeManager try: interface_mappings = n_utils.parse_mappings( launcher = service.launch(cfg.CONF, agent) launcher.wait()
deleted_lines: from neutron.common import utils as q_utilsfrom neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent import \ LinuxBridgeNeutronAgentRPC, LinuxBridgeManager # maybe what is below is not needed for bagpipe-l2 try: interface_mappings = q_utils.parse_mappings( agent.daemon_loop() sys.exit(0)

commit_message:
ceph: make the driver asynchronous

The ceph driver need the gnocchi-metricd to work now.

The measurements are now ingested asynchronously.

Change-Id: I00639ac48073d0e70d79f722976b9a40f746fbf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/40/199140/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, kvs, kvs_xattrs): self.kvs_xattrs = kvs_xattrs def _ensure_key_exists(self, key): if key not in self.kvs: self.kvs[key] = "" self.kvs_xattrs[key] = {} self._ensure_key_exists(key) self._ensure_key_exists(key) self._ensure_key_exists(key) def get_xattrs(self, key): if key not in self.kvs: raise FakeRadosModule.ObjectNotFound return iter((k, v) for k, v in self.kvs_xattrs.get(key, {}).items()) def set_xattr(self, key, attr, value): self._ensure_key_exists(key) xattrs = self.kvs_xattrs.setdefault(key, {}) xattrs[attr] = value def rm_xattr(self, key, attr): if key not in self.kvs: raise FakeRadosModule.ObjectNotFound del self.kvs_xattrs[key][attr] del self.kvs_xattrs[key] def __init__(self, kvs, kvs_xattrs): self.kvs_xattrs = kvs_xattrs return FakeRadosModule.ioctx(self.kvs, self.kvs_xattrs) self.kvs_xattrs = {} return FakeRadosModule.FakeRados(self.kvs, self.kvs_xattrs)

commit_message:
Avoid cloning neutron on test jobs

Mimic what neutron-lbaas is doing to avoid cloning
neutron repo on each test job, following guidance by
fungi.

Change-Id: I4c3bbaf568ba7ac96caf7534ec4294e18d6c7cee

commit_message:
Fix minion registration failure

The indentation of the minion registration script is wrong. As a
result, the command will fail and no minion will be registered.

Change-Id: Ic453a2b325d19575566f5fca75bfa109bb826994
Closes-Bug: 1472046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/39/198939/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "unregistering minion $myip" kubectl -s ${master_url} delete minion/$myip echo "registering minion $myip" cpu=$(($(nproc) * 1000)) memory=$(awk '/MemTotal: /{print $2 * 1024}' /proc/meminfo) cat <<EOF | kubectl create -s ${master_url} -f- apiVersion: v1beta1 id: $myip kind: Minion resources: capacity: cpu: $cpu memory: $memory EOF
deleted_lines: echo "unregistering minion $myip" kubectl -s ${master_url} delete minion/$myip echo "registering minion $myip" cpu=$(($(nproc) * 1000)) memory=$(awk '/MemTotal: /{print $2 * 1024}' /proc/meminfo) cat <<EOF | kubectl create -s ${master_url} -f- apiVersion: v1beta1 id: $myip kind: Minion resources: capacity: cpu: $cpu memory: $memory EOF

"org/</link>) and Percona XtraDB Cluster (<link href="http://www.percona.com/" "">http://www.percona.com/</link>) also work with Galera. You also have the " "option to use PostgreSQL, which has its own replication, or another database " "HA option." msgstr "" "MySQL + Galera MariaDB Galera " "(<link href="https://mariadb.org/">https://mariadb.org/</link>)  " "Percona XtraDB (<link href="http://www.percona.com/">http://www." "percona.com/</link>)  Galera  OpenStack  " "PostgreSQLPostgreSQL " "Note that the installation requirements call for careful attention. Read the " "guide <link href="https://launchpadlibrarian.net/66669857/README-wsrep" "">https://launchpadlibrarian.net/66669857/README-wsrep</link> to ensure you " "follow all the required steps." msgstr "" " Wresp API   <link href="https://launchpadlibrarian." "net/66669857/README-wsrep">https://launchpadlibrarian.net/66669857/README-" "wsrep</link>" msgid ""msgid "" "OpenStack infrastructure high availability relies on the <link href="http://" "www.clusterlabs.org">Pacemaker</link> cluster stack, the state-of-the-art " "high availability and load balancing stack for the Linux platform. Pacemaker " "is storage and application-agnostic, and is in no way specific to OpenStack." msgstr "" "OpenStack  <link href="http://www.clusterlabs.org" "">Pacemaker</link>  Pacemaker  Linux " " Packermaker " " OpenStack " "Pacemaker relies on the <link href="http://www.corosync.org">Corosync</" "link> messaging layer for reliable cluster communications. Corosync " "implements the Totem single-ring ordering and membership protocol. It also " "provides UDP and InfiniBand based messaging, quorum, and cluster membership " "to Pacemaker." msgstr "" "Pacemaker  <link href="http://www.corosync.org">Corosync</link> " "Corosync  Totem " " UDP  InfiniBand  " "Pacemaker " msgid ""msgid "" "Rather than starting with a vanilla version of MySQL, and then adding " "Galera, you will want to install a version of MySQL patched for wsrep (Write " "Set REPlication) from <link href="https://launchpad.net/codership-mysql" "">https://launchpad.net/codership-mysql</link>. The wsrep API is suitable " "for configuring MySQL High Availability in OpenStack because it supports " "synchronous replication." msgstr "" " MySQL  Galera  <link href=" ""https://launchpad.net/codership-mysql">https://launchpad.net/codership-" "mysql</link> wsrep (Write Set REPlication)  MySQL , " "wsrep API  OpenStack  MySQL " "The Telemetry Central agent can be configured to partition its polling " "workload between multiple agents, enabling high availability. Please refer " "to <link href="http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/" "section_telemetry-cetral-compute-agent-ha.html"> this section</link> of the " "<citetitle>OpenStack Cloud Administrator Guide</citetitle> for the " "requirements and implementation details of this configuration." msgstr "" "Telemetry" "<citetitle>OpenStack</citetitle><link href=" ""http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/section_telemetry-" "cetral-compute-agent-ha.html"> </link>" msgid """To install and configure it, read the <link href="http://code.google.com/p/" "memcached/wiki/NewStart"> official documentation</link>." msgstr "" "<application>Memcached</application>  <link href=" ""http://code.google.com/p/memcached/wiki/NewStart"> </link>" msgid """You can change the mirror to one near you on: <link href="https://downloads." "mariadb.org/mariadb/repositories/">downloads.mariadb.org</link>" msgstr "" "<link href="https://downloads.mariadb.org/" "mariadb/repositories/">downloads.mariadb.org</link>" msgid """You will find at <link href="http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ceilometer/" "install/manual.html#installing-the-central-agent">this page</link> the " "process to install the Telemetry central agent." msgstr "" " Telemtry <link href="http://docs.openstack.org/" "developer/ceilometer/install/manual.html#installing-the-central-agent"> " " </link>" msgid ""

commit_message:
Use empty lists for unused alarm actions

This change correctly sets the unused actions in a Ceilometer alarm to
empty lists instead of None.

Change-Id: I467c66f6ab2d45c5648a151b5a1165f95d29dfb4
Closes-Bug: #1472891

"""The <link href="http://www.fedramp.gov">Federal Risk and Authorization " "Management Program</link> (FedRAMP) is a government-wide program that " "provides a standardized approach to security assessment, authorization, and " "continuous monitoring for cloud products and services". NIST 800-53 is the " "basis for both FISMA and FedRAMP which mandates security controls " "specifically selected to provide protection in cloud environments. FedRAMP " "can be extremely intensive from specificity around security controls, and " "the volume of documentation required to meet government standards." msgstr "" ""<link href="http://www.fedramp.gov">Federal Risk and Authorization " "Management Program</link> (FedRAMP)" "" "" NIST 800-53FISMARedRAMP" "" "FedRAMP" "" msgid ""msgid "" "<citetitle>OpenStack End User Guide</citetitle> section <link href="http://" "docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/cli_openrc.html">Download and source " "the OpenStack RC file</link>" msgstr "" "<citetitle>OpenStack </citetitle>  <link href=" ""http://docs.openstack.org/ja/user-guide/content/cli_openrc.html" "">OpenStack RC </link>" msgid "" "<citetitle>OpenStack End User Guide</citetitle> section <link href="http://" "docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/section_cli_overview.html">command-" "line clients overview</link>" msgstr "" "<citetitle>OpenStack </citetitle> : <link href=" ""http://docs.openstack.org/ja/user-guide/content/section_cli_overview.html" ""></link>" msgid "" "<citetitle>OpenStack Operations Guide</citetitle> on <link href="http://" "docs.openstack.org/openstack-ops/content/backup_and_recovery.html">backup " "and recovery</link>" msgstr "" "<citetitle>OpenStack </citetitle>  <link href="http://docs." Safe Harbor framework, the " "ISO/IEC 29100:2011 privacy framework or with other privacy-specific " "guidelines. In the U.S. the AICPA has <link href="http://www.aicpa.org/" "interestareas/informationtechnology/resources/privacy/" "generallyacceptedprivacyprinciples/">defined 10 privacy areas of focus</" "link>, OpenStack deployments within a commercial environment may desire to " "attest to some or all of these principles." msgstr "" "OpenStack - EU" "ISO/IEC 29100:2011 " "AICPA<link " "href="http://www.aicpa.org/interestareas/informationtechnology/resources/" "privacy/generallyacceptedprivacyprinciples/">10" "</link>OpenStack" "" msgid """AppArmor.net, AppArmor Main Page. 2011. <link href="http://wiki.apparmor." "net/index.php/Main_Page">AppArmor: Linux security module implementing MAC</" "link>" msgstr "" "AppArmor.net, AppArmor Main Page. 2011. <link href="http://wiki.apparmor." Memory Deduplication as a Threat to " "the Guest OS. 2011. <link href="https://staff.aist.go.jp/c.artho/papers/" "EuroSec2011-suzaki.pdf">https://staff.aist.go.jp/c.artho/papers/EuroSec2011-" "suzaki.pdf</link>" msgstr "" "Artho, Yagi, Iijima, Kuniyasu Suzaki. Memory Deduplication as a Threat to " "the Guest OS. 2011. <link href="https://staff.aist.go.jp/c.artho/papers/" "EuroSec2011-suzaki.pdf">https://staff.aist.go.jp/c.artho/papers/EuroSec2011-" "suzaki.pdf</link>" msgid """As OpenStack is a popular open source project, much of the codebase and " "architecture has been scrutinized by individual contributors, organizations " "and enterprises. This can be advantageous from a security perspective, " "however the need for security reviews is still a critical consideration for " "service providers, as deployments vary, and security is not always the " "primary concern for contributors. A comprehensive security review process " "may include architectural review, threat modelling, source code analysis and " "penetration testing. There are many techniques and recommendations for " "conducting security reviews that can be found publicly posted. A well-tested " "example is the <link href="http://www.microsoft.com/security/sdl/process/" "release.aspx">Microsoft SDL</link>, created as part of the Microsoft " "Trustworthy Computing Initiative." msgstr "" "OpenStack" "" "" "" "" "" "" "Microsoft Trustworthy " "Computing Initiative<link href="http://www." "microsoft.com/security/sdl/process/release.aspx">Microsoft SDL</link>" "" msgid """At this point we know that the node has booted with the correct kernel and " "underlying components. There are many paths for hardening a given operating " "system deployment. The specifics on these steps are outside of the scope of " "this book. We recommend following the guidance from a hardening guide " "specific to your operating system. For example, the <link href="http://iase." "disa.mil/stigs/">security technical implementation guides</link> (STIG) and " "the <link href="http://www.nsa.gov/ia/mitigation_guidance/" "security_configuration_guides/">NSA guides</link> are useful starting " "places." msgstr "" "" "" "" "" "<link href="http://iase.disa.mil/stigs/" "">security technical implementation guides</link> (STIG)  <link href=" ""http://www.nsa.gov/ia/mitigation_guidance/security_configuration_guides/" "">NSA guides</link> " msgid """Before we delve into the configurations, we briefly discuss the ciphers' " "configuration element and its format. subject: Fix a bug in environment module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 05:47:35.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/environment.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/0708e6350c12230642501590ecfa8eec4d76f2b4', 'message': 'Fix a bug in environment module

Global variable _environment should be declared before being used
in global_env function. This patch fixed this error.

Change-Id: I808aa4fe76851c33e2670b2c9b7c732992b27027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in environment module

Global variable _environment should be declared before being used
in global_env function. This patch fixed this error.

Change-Id: I808aa4fe76851c33e2670b2c9b7c732992b27027
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/72/199872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: global _environment

commit_message:
Ignore invalid PIDs in swift-init

While reviewing ab9f6340 I recognized that invalid pids in the pid files raise
an exceptions (in case it is not a number), and also accept a 0 that is
impossible to use as a pid for any Swift process. In the latter case the process
was recognized as runnning, even if it did not - and thus restarting didn't
worked.

This patch ensures a better handling of any non-numeric value and also removes a
pid file if it uses 0 as the pid.

Change-Id: I09c415c7a75e4b9a0574a08f46f48fff5bb11d02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/03/186703/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix git clone for locally running tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 19:00:56.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/275fb9b111bbb30148e762afc0798aa891091cf2', 'message': "Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git

commit_message:
Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: Iec2fec4b59ac12626a14b9926f07f867017c59d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/00/199700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}"

commit_message:
Fix asserts in TestRoles.test_roles_add_and_remove

Used assertItemsEqual instead of assertEqual so it will not
fail when order change.

Change-Id: I5fb2c6325ac668e98a171b5dab44ea08eb1430b0
Closes-Bug: #1472592
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/24/199524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertItemsEqual(expected_roles, new_roles)

commit_message:
[network-guide] Update provider LB scenario

Update provider networks with Linux bridge scenario as
follows:

1) Remove extraneous configuration from neutron and ML2
   configuration on compute nodes.
2) Explicitly disable VXLAN tunnels.
3) Fix various conventions issues.
4) Generally improve wording and diagrams.

Partial-Bug: #1465778
Change-Id: I41bcf711259b318d63a7c0febd0e02d6b83611e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/76/199776/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: support for keystone v3 api - v3 domain utility code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 20:13:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/550f32b0b8d1c94e1ae02484aa0b47fc9b25bc01', 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - v3 domain utility code

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Adds some utility code for domain handling.  Puppet code may need
to specify resource titles as "name::domain" e.g. "admin::admin_domain".
The function split_domain is used to split a name in this format into
its ['name', 'domain'] components as an array.
Usually providers will not need to use this, they will use the
name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value, then ENV['OS_DOMAIN_NAME'], then
ENV['OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN'].
If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain.  Note that this is the _id_,
not the _name_.  With the openstack cli, the domain name and id are
interchangeable, so this should be ok.
If all else fails, the domain name will be 'Default' which is the
"default" default domain name used by Keystone.
2) Adds the method domain_name_from_id - the providers and other code
will need to map from the domain id to the name, and this method
provides that mapping.
Change-Id: Ifb8171b78904257f8112e1485d5255f0d0f5aca8

If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]

name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value.
If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain id, and look up the domain
name using the 'domain list' operation to create a mapping.
If all else fails, the domain name will be 'Default' which is the
"default" default domain name used by Keystone.

2) Adds the method domain_name_from_id - the providers and other code
will need to map from the domain id to the name, and this method
provides that mapping.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: Ifb8171b78904257f8112e1485d5255f0d0f5aca8
Depends-On: Icafc4cb8ed000fd9d3ed6ffde2afe1a1250d90af

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Adds some utility code for domain handling.  Puppet code may need
to specify resource titles as "name::domain" e.g. "admin::admin_domain".
The function split_domain is used to split a name in this format into
its ['name', 'domain'] components as an array.
Usually providers will not need to use this, they will use the
name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value.
If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain id, and look up the domain
name using the 'domain list' operation to create a mapping.
If all else fails, the domain name will be 'Default' which is the
"default" default domain name used by Keystone.

2) Adds the method domain_name_from_id - the providers and other code
will need to map from the domain id to the name, and this method
provides that mapping.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: Ifb8171b78904257f8112e1485d5255f0d0f5aca8
Depends-On: Icafc4cb8ed000fd9d3ed6ffde2afe1a1250d90af

commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - v3 domain utility code

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Adds some utility code for domain handling.  Puppet code may need
to specify resource titles as "name::domain" e.g. "admin::admin_domain".
The function split_domain is used to split a name in this format into
its ['name', 'domain'] components as an array.
Usually providers will not need to use this, they will use the
name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value.
If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain id, and look up the domain
name using the 'domain list' operation to create a mapping.
If all else fails, the domain name will be 'Default' which is the
"default" default domain name used by Keystone.

2) Adds the method domain_name_from_id - the providers and other code
will need to map from the domain id to the name, and this method
provides that mapping.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: Ifb8171b78904257f8112e1485d5255f0d0f5aca8
Depends-On: Icafc4cb8ed000fd9d3ed6ffde2afe1a1250d90af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/85/178385/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet' require 'spec_helper' require 'puppet/util/keystone_v3' describe "split_domain method" do it 'should handle nil and empty strings' do expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('')).to eq(['', nil]) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain(nil)).to eq([nil, nil]) end it 'should return name and no domain' do expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo')).to eq(['foo', nil]) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo::')).to eq(['foo', nil]) end it 'should return name and domain' do expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo::bar')).to eq(['foo', 'bar']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo::bar::')).to eq(['foo', 'bar']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo::bar')).to eq(['::foo', 'bar']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo::bar::')).to eq(['::foo', 'bar']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo::bar::baz')).to eq(['foo::bar', 'baz']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('foo::bar::baz::')).to eq(['foo::bar', 'baz']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo::bar::baz')).to eq(['::foo::bar', 'baz']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo::bar::baz::')).to eq(['::foo::bar', 'baz']) end it 'should return domain only' do expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo')).to eq([nil, 'foo']) expect(KeystoneV3Util.split_domain('::foo::')).to eq([nil, 'foo']) end end

commit_message:
Added --silent flag to npm run template.

npm run creates, effectively, a virtualenv, and runs any script
within that environment. Rather than simply pass through an error
code that is returned by the child command, it also adds its own
error messaging which is, at best, noise. Adding the --silent flag
removes this additional noise, while retaining the exit code and
the console output from the child command.

Change-Id: I32909e910bfc3d773dc25ff25e9dc8b366acd475

commit_message:
Python 3: Use range instead of xrange()

xrange() was removed in python 3. So we use range instead.

Change-Id: I2bff3c914c4b4388ea8e99d814cbd5f14d605913
Partial-Bug: #1470344

subject: Fix git clone for locally running tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 19:00:30.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/0bb7577f7e4189495a148ca91f4f92c118e499e7', 'message': "Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: I543148dd97f7415b1e461b8300cffc5f7f191ecd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: I543148dd97f7415b1e461b8300cffc5f7f191ecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/91/199691/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}"

commit_message:
Support a flag for preserving partitions in Volume Manager

Add an attribute 'keep_data' to list of attributes of a
partition to indicate that data on that partition must
be preserved during provisioning and deployment of the node.

Change-Id: I5a6660c59d230632499de89c2eb17ce718e7481e
Implements: blueprint partition-preservation

added_lines: volume_manager.set_volume_size(disk['id'], volume['name'], volume['size']) full_format = volume_manager.set_volume_flags( disk['id'], volume) def set_keep_flag(self, name, value): """Set keep flag """ for volume in self.volumes: if (volume.get('type') == 'partition' and volume.get('name') == name): volume['keep'] = bool(value) def set_volume_flags(self, disk_id, volume): """Set flags of volume """ volume_name = volume['name'] self.__logger('Update volume flags for disk=%s volume_name=%s' % (disk_id, volume_name)) disk = filter(lambda disk: disk.id == disk_id, self.disks)[0] if volume_name == 'ceph': disk.set_keep_flag(volume_name, volume.get('keep')) for idx, volume in enumerate(self.volumes): if volume.get('id') == disk.id: self.volumes[idx] = disk.render() self.__logger('Updated volume flags %s' % self.volumes) return self.volumes

commit_message:
Fix issues with allocation pool generation for ::/64 cidr

Passing a ::/64 cidr to certain netaddr functions without specifying
the ip_version causes errors. Fix this by specifying ip_version.

Change-Id: I31aaf9f5dabe4dd0845507f245387cd4186c410c
Closes-Bug: 1472304
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/76/199176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_generate_pools_v6_empty(self): # We want to be sure the range will begin and end with an IPv6 # address, even if an ambiguous ::/64 cidr is given. cidr = '::/64' expected = [netaddr.IPRange('::1', '::FFFF:FFFF:FFFF:FFFF')] self.assertEqual(expected, utils.generate_pools(cidr, None))

1) Implements the domain aware keystone_tenant (project) resource.

Adds support for a :domain property of a tenant/project, and allows
the domain to be specified as "name::domain" in the :name property.
The new code tries to use the id as much as possible, since it is
the id that uniquely identifies the project/tenant among all of
the domains, and using id means that name + domain are not required.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I1f703affa6172a3e759e2d62422a87073262acc4

commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - the project resource

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Implements the domain aware keystone_tenant (project) resource.

Adds support for a :domain property of a tenant/project, and allows
the domain to be specified as "name::domain" in the :name property.
The new code tries to use the id as much as possible, since it is
the id that uniquely identifies the project/tenant among all of
the domains, and using id means that name + domain are not required.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: I1f703affa6172a3e759e2d62422a87073262acc4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/68/174468/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def self.get_api_version_for_url "v3" end def self.get_api_version_for_cmd ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"] end # see if resource[:domain], or project_name::project_domain project_name, project_domain = name_and_domain if project_domain properties << '--domain' properties << project_domain end @instance = request('project', 'create', project_name, resource[:auth], properties) request('project', 'delete', id, resource[:auth]) def domain=(value) @property_flush[:domain] = value end def domain instance(resource[:name])[:domain] end :domain => domain_name_from_id(project[:domain_id]), :domain_id => project[:domain_id], :domain => domain_name_from_id(project[:domain_id]), :domain_id => project[:domain_id], # name may be "project_name" or "project_name::project_domain" # for domain, use the resource[:domain] first, then use # the domain part of name, then use the default domain project_name, project_domain = name_and_domain @instance ||= instances.select do |inst| inst[:name] == project_name and (inst[:domain].nil? or inst[:domain].empty? or (inst[:domain] == project_domain) or (inst[:domain_id] == project_domain)) end.first || {} (options << '--domain' << "#{resource[:domain]}") if @property_flush[:domain] request('project', 'set', id, resource[:auth], options) unless options.empty?
deleted_lines: @instance = request('project', 'create', resource[:name], resource[:auth], properties) request('project', 'delete', resource[:name], resource[:auth]) @instance ||= instances.select { |instance| instance[:name] == name }.first || {} request('project', 'set', resource[:name], resource[:auth], options) unless options.empty?

subject: support for keystone v3 api - the domain resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-16 15:52:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/a30e20f12d83a5bea88f0bd7f4ee82b8ebddfb94', 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - the domain resource

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file
in the [identity] default_domain_id parameter.  Since there is no
way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to use the ruby code
to ensure that the parameter has the correct domain id in the
keystone.conf file.
b) When creating a domain that is going to be the admin domain, that
is, the domain containing the cloud admin user, we need to write the
id of that domain to the policy.json file, to make the 'cloud_admin'
value look like this:
  is_admin:1 or (rule:admin_required and domain_id:id_of_domain)
Since there is no way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to
use the ruby code to ensure that the policy file has the correct
value.

2) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.  The
keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".
b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

3) Adds some utility code for domain handling.  Puppet code may need
to specify resource titles as "name::domain" e.g. "admin::admin_domain".
The function split_domain is used to split a name in this format into
its ['name', 'domain'] components as an array.
Usually providers will not need to use this, they will use the
name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value, then ENV['OS_DOMAIN_NAME'], then
ENV['OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN'].  For testing/migration purposes, there is
a hack that allows you to specify the default domain to use.  On
nodes where keystone is not installed, there is no keystone.conf, and
therefore no way to get the [identity] default_domain_id.  You can
create a file called /tmp/.domain like this:

[DEFAULT]
default_domain_name=domainname
default_domain_id=domainid

It will use default_domain_name first, then default_domain_id.

Finally, if keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain.

Change-Id: Idc88fb22de8a9a9c8b1f6dfef8ae018190f254e1

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file
in the [identity] default_domain_id parameter.  Since there is no
way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to use the ruby code
to ensure that the parameter has the correct domain id in the
keystone.conf file.
b) When creating a domain that is going to be the admin domain, that
is, the domain containing the cloud admin user, we need to write the
id of that domain to the policy.json file, to make the 'cloud_admin'
value look like this:
  is_admin:1 or (rule:admin_required and domain_id:id_of_domain)
Since there is no way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to
use the ruby code to ensure that the policy file has the correct
value.

2) Allows the providers to use the v2 or v3 identity api.  The
keystone.rb provider provides these methods:
a) self.get_api_version_for_url - this is the version suffix to use
for the authentication endpoint.  By default it is "v2.0".  Providers
that support the v3 api should override this method to return "v3".
b) self.get_api_version_for_cmd - this is the api version provided
to the openstack command as --os-identity-api-version.  By default
this function returns [] the empty array which tells openstack to
use the version 2 default.  Providers that support the v3 api should
override this method to return ["--os-identity-api-version", "3"].

3) Adds some utility code for domain handling.  Puppet code may need
to specify resource titles as "name::domain" e.g. "admin::admin_domain".
The function split_domain is used to split a name in this format into
its ['name', 'domain'] components as an array.
Usually providers will not need to use this, they will use the
name_and_domain method in the keystone.rb provider.  This is resource
aware and will try many different ways to get a domain to use for
the provider:  resource[:domain], then the domain part of
'name::domain' name/title value, then ENV['OS_DOMAIN_NAME'], then
ENV['OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN'].
If keystone.conf is available, it will use [identity]
default_domain_id as the default domain.  Note that this is the _id_,
not the _name_.  With the openstack cli, the domain name and id are
interchangeable, so this should be ok.
If all else fails, the domain name will be 'Default' which is the
"default" default domain name used by Keystone.

4) Adds the method domain_name_from_id - the providers and other code
will need to map from the domain id to the name, and this method
provides that mapping.
Change-Id: Idc88fb22de8a9a9c8b1f6dfef8ae018190f254e1

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file

id of that domain to the policy.json file, to make the 'cloud_admin'

is_admin:1 or (rule:admin_required and domain_id:id_of_domain)
Since there is no way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to
use the ruby code to ensure that the policy file has the correct
value.

"}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2015-05-06 15:41:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/1e7322947650c1d44909e69ac6e73af0bcd40e26', 'message': "support for keystone v3 api - the domain resource

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file
in the [identity] default_domain_id parameter.  Since there is no
way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to use the ruby code
to ensure that the parameter has the correct domain id in the
keystone.conf file.

b) When creating a domain that is going to be the admin domain, that
is, the domain containing the cloud admin user, we need to write the
id of that domain to the policy.json file, to make the 'cloud_admin'
value look like this:
is_admin:1 or (rule:admin_required and domain_id:id_of_domain)
Since there is no way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to
use the ruby code to ensure that the policy file has the correct
value.

c) When deleting a domain, have to disable it first.  Keystone does not
allow you to delete an enabled domain.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: Idc88fb22de8a9a9c8b1f6dfef8ae018190f254e1

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file
in the [identity] default_domain_id parameter.  Since there is no

its default value.

allow you to delete an enabled domain.

commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - the domain resource

This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:

1) Implements the keystone_domain resource.  Domain creation/ensure
has a couple of special cases:
a) When creating a domain that is going to be the default domain,
we need to write the id of that domain to the keystone.conf file
in the [identity] default_domain_id parameter.  Since there is no
way to get that id at the puppet level, we have to use the ruby code
to ensure that the parameter has the correct domain id in the
keystone.conf file.  Likewise, when removing the default domain,
ensure that we reset the [identity] default_domain_id parameter to
its default value.

b) When deleting a domain, have to disable it first.  Keystone does not
allow you to delete an enabled domain.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support

Change-Id: Idc88fb22de8a9a9c8b1f6dfef8ae018190f254e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/39/174439/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet' require 'spec_helper' require 'puppet/util/v3' describe "split_domain method" do it 'should handle nil and empty strings' do split_domain('').should == ['', nil] split_domain(nil).should == [nil, nil] end it 'should return name and no domain' do split_domain('foo').should == ['foo', nil] split_domain('foo::').should == ['foo', nil] end it 'should return name and domain' do split_domain('foo::bar').should == ['foo', 'bar'] split_domain('foo::bar::').should == ['foo', 'bar'] split_domain('::foo::bar').should == ['::foo', 'bar'] split_domain('::foo::bar::').should == ['::foo', 'bar'] split_domain('foo::bar::baz').should == ['foo::bar', 'baz'] split_domain('foo::bar::baz::').should == ['foo::bar', 'baz'] split_domain('::foo::bar::baz').should == ['::foo::bar', 'baz'] split_domain('::foo::bar::baz::').should == ['::foo::bar', 'baz'] end it 'should return domain only' do split_domain('::foo').should == [nil, 'foo'] split_domain('::foo::').should == [nil, 'foo'] end end

commit_message:
Catch exception.Unauthorized when checking for admin

This prevents a traceback to the user from Unauthorized
when checking if a user is an admin. A docstring was
also added to the function that raises Unauthorized.

Change-Id: Ia50b853a033433b77e6dc58d5e608ba179d13301
Closes-Bug: #996912
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/71/198071/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Ensure the user is an admin. An Unauthorized exception will be raised if a token could not be found/authorized, a user is invalid, or a tenant is invalid/not scoped. Additionally, a Forbidden exception will be raised if the user is not an admin and does not has the admin role. :raises exception.Unauthorized, exception.Forbidden """

commit_message:
Add security groups events

ML2 mech drivers have no direct exposure to security groups,
and they can only infer them from the associated network/ports.
This is problematic as agentless ML2 mech drivers have no way of
intercepting securitygroups events and propagate the information
to their backend, or more generally, react to them.

This patch leverages the callback registry to dispatch such events
so that interested ML2 mech drivers (or any interested party like
service plugins) can be notified and react accordingly.

This patch addresses create/update/delete of security groups and
create/delete of security groups rules. Other events may be added
over time, if need be.

This patch is only about emitting the events. The actual subscription
and implementation of the event handlers will have to take place where
deemed appropriate.

Closes-bug: #1444112

Change-Id: Ifa1d7ee9c967576f824f1129dd68e6e3abd48f5c
(cherry picked from commit 868e67b480b08cc815d802cf950547c6b5ac0153)

commit_message:
Python 3: Use next() instead of generator.next()

generator.next() was removed in python 3. So we use next() instead.

Change-Id: I1eda5fc1dc35e5d07bd76a5a1ef0c96ba41fd151
Partial-Bug: #1470344

commit_message:
Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: Ib32e5a9b5aba856ba65d2f9fbf19310578b1354a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/06/199706/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}"

commit_message:
Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: Ie5db369448f7fc0520bb559c134b2a56bb2b6743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/90/199690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}"

commit_message:
Adding script for rewrapping p11 KEKs

This script pulls all project available KEKs and rewraps them
with a MKEK specified in the barbican config file.

Change-Id: I5f130b8f6d744195e3ed6c708e96b23b200eea2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/70/196270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Attribute(CKA_LABEL, str(mkek_label)) def rewrap_kek(self, iv, wrapped_key, hmac, mkek_label, hmac_label, key_length, session): unwrapped_kek = self.unwrap_key(iv, hmac, wrapped_key, mkek_label, hmac_label, session) mkek = self.key_handles[self.current_mkek_label] iv = self.generate_random(16, session) mech = self.ffi.new("CK_MECHANISM *") mech.mechanism = CKM_AES_CBC_PAD mech.parameter = iv mech.parameter_len = 16 padded_length = key_length + self.block_size buf = self.ffi.new("CK_BYTE[{0}]".format(padded_length)) buf_len = self.ffi.new("CK_ULONG *", padded_length) rv = self.lib.C_WrapKey( session, mech, mkek, unwrapped_kek, buf, buf_len ) self.check_error(rv) wrapped_kek = self.ffi.buffer(buf, buf_len[0])[:] hmac = self.compute_hmac(wrapped_kek, session) return { 'iv': base64.b64encode(self.ffi.buffer(iv)[:]), 'wrapped_key': base64.b64encode(wrapped_kek), 'hmac': base64.b64encode(hmac), 'mkek_label': self.current_mkek_label, 'hmac_label': self.current_hmac_label }

commit_message:
L3 agent should do report state before full sync at start

Sometimes the AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception is reported during
L3-agent startup. The exception is generated when the first
get_routers RPC call is made. When the neutron server gets this
RPC call, it might not have handled the report state RPC call yet.
So the L3-agent hasn't been registered in the API server.
The result is a RPC Error exception.  By the time the next
get_routers RPC call is made, the report state RPC call has already
been done and agent registered.

This patch modifies the L3 agent startup behavior to have the report
state done before the agent do the sync routers RPC call.

Note: files in the merge conflict list are not in the stable/juno
branch. They were moved during the kilo development cycle:
 * neutron/agent/l3_agent.py is moved to neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
in kilo.
 * neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py is moved to
neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py in kilo.

Conflicts:
        neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py

(cherry picked from commit e801eb29d79a8d1f689394756c7870b11ae75c1b)
Closes-bug: 1456822
Change-Id: Id40cfd8466f45e20fea0e9df6fd57bf9c9e59da7

commit_message:
Controller worker create lb integration tests

These tests are what I've written to test the controller worker
out against real nova, neutron, and database environments.  It may be
decided that we do not need these because tempest tests should do the
same job, but throwing this out there anyway.  Nice to have something
now than nothing. Should just require using the octavia devstack plugin
and running these tests.  Hopefully at least. :)

Change-Id: I37e55f0ee9bfa1bbf579f5b438ac406cecd18b9b

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from neutronclient.neutron import client as neutron_client from novaclient import client as nova_client from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_utils import uuidutils import testtools from octavia.common import config from octavia.common import constants from octavia.common import keystone from octavia.compute.drivers import nova_driver from octavia.controller.worker import controller_worker as worker from octavia.db import api as db_api from octavia.db import repositories NEUTRON_VERSION = '2.0' NOVA_VERSION = '2' class TestControllerWorker(testtools.TestCase): @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestControllerWorker, cls).setUpClass() config.init([]) # #TODO(blogan): Remove almost all of the setup below once the # octavia devstack plugin is complete cls.neutron_client = neutron_client.Client( NEUTRON_VERSION, session=keystone.get_session()) cls.nova_client = nova_client.Client( NOVA_VERSION, session=keystone.get_session()) images = cls.nova_client.images.list() for image in images: if image.name == 'amphora-x64-haproxy': cfg.CONF.set_override('amp_image_id', image.id, group='controller_worker') with open(cfg.CONF.haproxy_amphora.key_name) as f: key = f.read() cls.nova_client.keypairs.create( 'default', public_key=key) cfg.CONF.set_override('amp_ssh_key', 'default', group='controller_worker') net_json = {'network': {'name': cfg.CONF.networking.lb_network_name}} mgmt_net = cls.neutron_client.create_network(net_json) cls.mgmt_net_id = mgmt_net['network']['id'] cfg.CONF.set_override('amp_network', cls.mgmt_net_id, group='controller_worker') subnet_json = {'subnet': {'name': 'lb-mgmt-subnet', 'cidr': '11.0.0.0/24', 'network_id': cls.mgmt_net_id, 'ip_version': '4'}} mgmt_subnet = cls.neutron_client.create_subnet(subnet_json) cls.mgmt_subnet_id = mgmt_subnet['subnet']['id'] sec_grp_json = {'security_group': {'name': 'lb-mgmt-sec-grp'}} mgmt_sec_grp = cls.neutron_client.create_security_group(sec_grp_json) cls.mgmt_sec_grp_id = mgmt_sec_grp['security_group']['id'] cfg.CONF.set_override('amp_secgroup_list', [cls.mgmt_sec_grp_id], group='controller_worker') rule = {'security_group_rule': { 'protocol': 'icmp', 'security_group_id': cls.mgmt_sec_grp_id, 'direction': 'ingress'}} cls.neutron_client.create_security_group_rule(rule) rule = {'security_group_rule': { 'protocol': 'tcp', 'security_group_id': cls.mgmt_sec_grp_id, 'direction': 'ingress', 'port_range_min': '22', 'port_range_max': '22'}} cls.neutron_client.create_security_group_rule(rule) router = cls.neutron_client.list_routers(name='router1')['routers'][0] cls.router_id = router['id'] router_json = {'subnet_id': cls.mgmt_subnet_id} cls.neutron_client.add_interface_router(cls.router_id, router_json) vip_net = cls.neutron_client.create_network( {'network': {'name': 'vip-net'}}) cls.vip_net_id = vip_net['network']['id'] subnet_json = {'subnet': {'name': 'vip-subnet', 'cidr': '12.0.0.0/24', 'network_id': cls.vip_net_id, 'ip_version': '4'}} vip_subnet = cls.neutron_client.create_subnet(subnet_json) cls.vip_subnet_id = vip_subnet['subnet']['id'] cls.repos = repositories.Repositories() cls.worker = worker.ControllerWorker() cls.session = db_api.get_session() @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): super(TestControllerWorker, cls).tearDownClass() servers = cls.nova_client.servers.list() for server in servers: cls.nova_client.servers.delete(server.id) servers = cls.nova_client.servers.list() while len(servers) > 0: import time time.sleep(2) servers = cls.nova_client.servers.list() try: ports = cls.neutron_client.list_ports( name='octavia-port')['ports'] for port in ports: cls.neutron_client.delete_port(port['id']) except Exception: pass cls.neutron_client.delete_subnet(cls.vip_subnet_id) cls.neutron_client.delete_network(cls.vip_net_id) cls.neutron_client.remove_interface_router( cls.router_id, {'subnet_id': cls.mgmt_subnet_id}) cls.neutron_client.delete_security_group(cls.mgmt_sec_grp_id) cls.neutron_client.delete_subnet(cls.mgmt_subnet_id) cls.neutron_client.delete_network(cls.mgmt_net_id) cls.nova_client.keypairs.delete('default') def setUp(self): super(TestControllerWorker, self).setUp() lb_dict = {'name': 'test_lb', 'enabled': True, 'provisioning_status': constants.PENDING_CREATE, 'operating_status': constants.OFFLINE} vip_dict = {'network_id': self.vip_net_id} self.lb = self.repos.create_load_balancer_and_vip(self.session, lb_dict, vip_dict) # This will also delete vip due to cascade delete self.addCleanup(self.repos.load_balancer.delete, self.session, id=self.lb.id) def test_create_load_balancer_without_ready_amp(self): try: self.worker.create_load_balancer(self.lb.id) except Exception: # should look at logs or print messages to see what went wrong. # We want to keep this wrapped in try except because if it fails, # tearDownClass won't run pass lb = self.repos.load_balancer.get(db_api.get_session(), id=self.lb.id) for amp in lb.amphorae: self.addCleanup(self.nova_client.servers.delete, amp.compute_id) self.addCleanup(self.repos.amphora.delete, self.session, id=amp.id) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.ip_address) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.network_id) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.port_id) vip_port = self.neutron_client.show_port(lb.vip.port_id) vip_port = vip_port['port'] vip_ip_addr = vip_port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] self.assertEqual(vip_ip_addr, lb.vip.ip_address) def _create_ready_amp(self): nova = nova_driver.VirtualMachineManager() image_id = cfg.CONF.controller_worker.amp_image_id flavor_id = cfg.CONF.controller_worker.amp_flavor_id key_name = cfg.CONF.controller_worker.amp_ssh_key sec_grps = cfg.CONF.controller_worker.amp_secgroup_list mgmt_net = cfg.CONF.controller_worker.amp_network compute_id = nova.build(name='amp-1', amphora_flavor=flavor_id, image_id=image_id, key_name=key_name, sec_groups=sec_grps, network_ids=[mgmt_net]) nova_amp = nova.get_amphora(compute_id) while nova_amp.status != constants.ACTIVE: time.sleep(2) nova_amp = nova.get_amphora(compute_id) self.addCleanup(nova.delete, compute_id) amp = self.repos.amphora.create( db_api.get_session(), id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), compute_id=compute_id, lb_network_ip=nova_amp.lb_network_ip, status=constants.AMPHORA_READY) self.addCleanup(self.repos.amphora.delete, self.session, id=amp.id) return amp def test_create_load_balancer_with_ready_amp(self): amp = None try: amp = self._create_ready_amp() self.worker.create_load_balancer(self.lb.id) except Exception: # should look at logs or print messages to see what went wrong. # We want to keep this wrapped in try except because if it fails, # tearDownClass won't run pass lb = self.repos.load_balancer.get(db_api.get_session(), id=self.lb.id) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.ip_address) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.network_id) self.assertIsNotNone(lb.vip.port_id) vip_port = self.neutron_client.show_port(lb.vip.port_id) vip_port = vip_port['port'] vip_ip_addr = vip_port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] self.assertEqual(vip_ip_addr, lb.vip.ip_address) lb_amp = lb.amphorae[0] self.assertEqual(amp.id, lb_amp.id)

commit_message:
Added name as query parameter for listing

The octavia driver in neutron-lbaas has no knowledge of the internal
id of any of the entities, so like other vendors, the name field is
used to store the neutron-lbaas id.  This causes the need to have
the ability to filter lists by name.  Also added name field to
member and health monitor.

Change-Id: I03ffb24d7bc6b177bbd21ae5c727db4f08d36601

commit_message:
Integration tests to test out driver

In the absence of tempest tests, it would be nice to have some tests that
automatically run to verify drivers work correctly in a devstack environment.
These are meant for this, and will be very basic and simple for now.  They can
be removed later after tempest tests are in place, but that's up to a future
decision.

Change-Id: Iceb49dff47f7ef56aeee8e012f66a1ba079a134a

added_lines: # Copyright 2015, Rackspace # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time import testtools from octavia.amphorae.drivers.haproxy import ssh_driver from octavia.common import config from octavia.network.drivers.neutron import allowed_address_pairs from octavia.common import data_models from octavia.compute.drivers import nova_driver class TestSimpleDrivers(testtools.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestSimpleDrivers, self).setUp() config.init([]) vip_net_name = 'vip-net' protocol_ports = [('HTTP', 80)] amp_key_name = 'default' amp_image_name = 'amphora-x64-haproxy' amp_flavor = 2 lb_mgmt_sec_group_name = 'lb-mgmt-sec-grp' lb_mgmt_net_name = 'lb-mgmt-net' member_ip = '11.0.0.4' member_port = 80 self.comp_driver = nova_driver.VirtualMachineManager() self.net_driver = allowed_address_pairs.AllowedAddressPairsDriver() self.amp_driver = ssh_driver.HaproxyManager() self.vip_network_id = self.net_driver.neutron_client.list_networks(name=vip_net_name)['networks'][0]['id'] lb_mgmt_sec_group_id = self.net_driver.neutron_client.list_security_groups(name=lb_mgmt_sec_group_name)['security_groups'][0]['id'] lb_mgmt_network_id = self.net_driver.neutron_client.list_networks(name=lb_mgmt_net_name)['networks'][0]['id'] amp_image_id = [image.id for image in self.comp_driver._nova_client.images.list() if image.name == amp_image_name][0] amp1_compute_id = self.comp_driver.build(name='amp1', amphora_flavor=amp_flavor, image_id=amp_image_id, key_name=amp_key_name, sec_groups=[lb_mgmt_sec_group_id], network_ids=[lb_mgmt_network_id]) amp2_compute_id = self.comp_driver.build(name='amp2', amphora_flavor=amp_flavor, image_id=amp_image_id, key_name=amp_key_name, sec_groups=[lb_mgmt_sec_group_id], network_ids=[lb_mgmt_network_id]) # amp1_compute_id = 'b4ebe839-93d1-4337-80ad-4c9464b0e7a5' # amp2_compute_id = 'ce3c0d60-90ae-4355-8d7e-41aca429415c' self.build_wait(amp1_compute_id) self.build_wait(amp2_compute_id) amp1_mgmt_ip_addr = self.comp_driver.manager.get(server=amp1_compute_id).addresses[lb_mgmt_net_name][0]['addr'] amp2_mgmt_ip_addr = self.comp_driver.manager.get(server=amp2_compute_id).addresses[lb_mgmt_net_name][0]['addr'] amp1 = data_models.Amphora(compute_id=amp1_compute_id, lb_network_ip=amp1_mgmt_ip_addr) amp2 = data_models.Amphora(compute_id=amp2_compute_id, lb_network_ip=amp2_mgmt_ip_addr) member1 = data_models.Member(id='mem1', ip_address=member_ip, protocol_port=member_port, enabled=True, operating_status='ACTIVE', weight=1) pool1 = data_models.Pool(id='pool1', protocol='HTTP', lb_algorithm='ROUND_ROBIN', enabled=True, members=[member1]) member1.pool = pool1 listeners = [data_models.Listener(id=str(index), protocol_port=port[1], protocol=port[0], default_pool=pool1) for index, port in enumerate(protocol_ports)] pool1.listener = listeners[0] self.lb = data_models.LoadBalancer(id='0123456789', amphorae=[amp1, amp2], listeners=listeners) for listener in listeners: listener.load_balancer = self.lb def build_wait(self, compute_id): while True: status = self.comp_driver.manager.get(server=compute_id).status if status == 'ACTIVE': break if status == 'ERROR': raise Exception('Instance ERROR') time.sleep(1) def test_all(self): vip = self.net_driver.allocate_vip(network_id=self.vip_network_id) self.lb.vip = vip amps = self.net_driver.plug_vip(self.lb, vip) self.lb.amphorae[0].ha_ip = amps[0].ha_ip self.lb.amphorae[1].ha_ip = amps[1].ha_ip self.lb.amphorae[0].vrrp_ip = amps[0].vrrp_ip self.lb.amphorae[1].vrrp_ip = amps[1].vrrp_ip self.amp_driver.update(self.lb.listeners[0], vip)

commit_message:
Don't uninstall ceph packages at cleanup

We stop the services, which should be sufficient.
Uninstalling the packages means that doing repeated
runs with devstack takes longer than necessary.

Change-Id: I5626e42ce83710690a3523439bb2c9c9af560cd9

commit_message:
Remove unused files from tools/xen.

Most of unused files were used with build_domU_multi.sh which has been 
replaced by build_xva.sh. Besides tools/xen/scripts/templatedelete.sh 
was created for convenience purposes and now not in use.

Change-Id: I4282c779629e3413ee3cd3ff134c3b7b19eee487
Closes-Bug: #1470535

subject: Fix git clone for locally running tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 19:01:07.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper_acceptance.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-vswitch/commit/e73073a120d833958d22925a1badbc1ccdc0f15a', 'message': "Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: Ice5d2d72a3dd674cd09171d480d3517b96dae2a5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix git clone for locally running tests

Zuul-cloner's behavior is to clone the repository into a subdirectory
under a directory named for the repo namespace. Git's default behavior
is to just clone it directly into the present working directory. This
patch adds an argument to the git clone command to clone it into the
<namespace>/<repo name> directory, so that whether zuul-cloner or git
is used the repo ends up in the same directory relative to the PWD.

Change-Id: Ice5d2d72a3dd674cd09171d480d3517b96dae2a5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 05:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['glance/cmd/registry.py', 'glance/common/wsgi.py', 'glance/cmd/api.py', 'glance/cmd/search.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/a3850d6b91f66b198d7323f9909464a500aecfc6', 'message': "Don't choose and set eventlet's hub type by Glance

Eventlet's event loop hub dispatches I/O events and schedules

by eventlet. That means it doesn't need choose and set the hub

commit_message:
Don't choose and set eventlet's hub type by Glance

Eventlet's event loop hub dispatches I/O events and schedules
greenthreads. Eventlet tries to select the best hub implementation
for your system[1], and the hub will be set before any usage of it
by eventlet. That means it doesn't need choose and set the hub
type by Glance. For more details, please refer to [2].

[1]https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/eventlet/hubs/__init__.py#L36
[2]https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/master/doc/hubs.rst

Change-Id: Iabf604b88aa1af38938ee913d60e4a6cbb1cc996

commit_message:
Validate UUIDs before the driver sends them

Redis driver does not always validate UUIDs (claim ID, message ID
and client_uuid). This commit introduces validation of them before the
driver sends them.

Closes-Bug: #1367024
Change-Id: I08eaa7df1f6887224edd0a3324ee4e5db3f6c229

commit_message:
Update development-environment.rst guide

Update development-environment.rst guide to include recent changes, for example
removed or updated sample configuration files as well as installing required
dependencies.

With these changes applied it was possible to successfully run a Zaqar server.

Change-Id: If113dc39a7a5466f15ebd3d9defede4e8c1b8098
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/57/196557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2. Create the sample configuration file zaqar/etc/zaqar.conf.sample:: $ tox -e genconfig 3. Copy the Zaqar configuration samples to the directory .zaqar/::4. Find the [drivers] section in ~/.zaqar/zaqar.conf and specify mongodb as the message store::5. Find the [drivers:storage:mongodb] section and modify the URI to point to your local mongod instance::6. For logging, find the [handler_file] section in ~/.zaqar/logging.conf and modify as desired:: args=('zaqar.log', 'w') $ virtualenv zaqarenv $ source zaqarenv/bin/activate4. Install the required Python binding for MongoDB:: $ pip install pymongo 5. Start the Zaqar server::6. Verify Zaqar is running by creating a queue::7. Get ready to code!
deleted_lines: 2. Copy the Zaqar configuration samples to the directory .zaqar/::3. Find the [drivers] section in ~/.zaqar/zaqar.conf and specify mongodb as the message store::4. Find the [drivers:storage:mongodb] section and modify the URI to point to your local mongod instance::5. For logging, find the [DEFAULT] section in ~/.zaqar/zaqar.conf and modify as desired:: log_file = server.log $ virtualenv marconi $ source zaqar/bin/activate4. Start the Zaqar server::5. Verify Zaqar is running by creating a queue::6. Get ready to code!

commit_message:
Remove dependency on config file for db check_migration

The alembic check_migration command just needs a database connection
to do the check, so we can avoid referring to a config file which may
be in different places depending on how neutron is installed.

Change-Id: I2d8043538ce8cf9568a84d256dbe8e6d3c5e5e3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/33/199633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron-db-manage --service vpnaas --database-connection sqlite:// check_migration

commit_message:
Fuel keystone identity with existed ldap

1. Modify Cluster Creation Wizard page
  * Add switching identity backend option.
2. Modify Cluster setting tab.
  * Add ldap connection information forms.
  * Add services administrator assigning forms.
  * Add same account checkbox. Other service will use same account and
  password with keystone service.
  * When user change input, ui can adjust other attribute's value
  according to change field in openstack.yaml.

Implements blueprint fuel-with-existed-ldap

Change-Id: Ia79fd2458b8f6d4ebc0d15df7fea3977ba094bda

commit_message:
Add root-disable api

Added additional Discussion Summary section.

Change-Id: I240c680236dbdc23300041acc332864217680525
Implements: blueprint root-disable
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/37/189837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/template.rst .. ============ Root Disable ============ Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/root-disable Since there is the ability to enable a root user on an instance the ability to disable the root user should be provided as well. Problem description =================== Currently, the root user can be enabled on an instance. It is expected that the root user can also be disabled. Disabling the root user should not change the ability of the command root-show to determine if the root user has ever been enabled. Proposed change =============== This change will add a new root-disable command. The command will remove the root user from the specified instance. No changes will be made in the root_enable_history table from the execution of the command. This ensures the root-show command will continue to operate as expected. Configuration ------------- None Database -------- None Public API ---------- REST API: DELETE /instances/{id}/root Python API in class Root: def delete(self, instance): """Implements root-disable API. Removes the root user for the specified db instance. :param instance: The instance from which the root user is removed from """ CLI: trove root-disable <instance> Public API Security ------------------- None Internal API ------------ None Guest Agent ----------- The appropriate root disable method will added only for MySQL. All other datastores will also need to have the appropriate not implemented error. Alternatives ------------ Another option is root-disable will simply call root-enable and not return the password back to the user. This alternative also has no impact on the root-show. However, an operator may believe the root user to be completely removed from the database after the root-disable call is made. Leaving the root user may not be what the operator is expecting. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dloi Milestones ---------- liberty-1 Work Items ---------- - Implement CLI, Python API and REST API calls - In the guest add disable_root method for MySQL database and not implemented stubs for all other datastores - Unit and integration tests Upgrade Implications ==================== None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add to existing root enable tests to test disabling the root user. Documentation Impact ==================== New root-disable command needs to be added to the API documentation. References ========== None

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 01:22:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/openstack_functions.py', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/experimental-workers.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/cde45a535fa8ea9431d7f4e3e0ad296c7964db38', 'message': 'Use bindep in thin worker experimental job

Update the experimental nova Python 2.7 unit test job which runs on
thin "ubuntu-trusty" workers to use bindep for determining its
distro package dependencies, and rename it to something more
appropriate now that it's not actually using devstack-trusty workers
any longer. Also switch it from gerrit-git-prep to the new
zuul-git-prep builder macro, and while at it adjust zuul-git-prep to
have a zuul-branch-git-prep variant rather than requiring a branch
parameter for the more common case.

Change-Id: Ib3f4844c1203f8a3890d9e5d91347d4507b5d08b
'}]
commit_message:
Use bindep in thin worker experimental job

Update the experimental nova Python 2.7 unit test job which runs on
thin "ubuntu-trusty" workers to use bindep for determining its
distro package dependencies, and rename it to something more
appropriate now that it's not actually using devstack-trusty workers
any longer. Also switch it from gerrit-git-prep to the new
zuul-git-prep builder macro, and while at it adjust zuul-git-prep to
have a zuul-branch-git-prep variant rather than requiring a branch
parameter for the more common case.

Change-Id: Ib3f4844c1203f8a3890d9e5d91347d4507b5d08b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/64/199364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Heat scenario to test scaling policies

Scenario triggers scaling policy webhooks and tracks their
performance.

Change-Id: I82270c1ceb2bf99254581b0b57f152a1361298d2
